website_summaries.verdict: Investment advice that's written in an entertaining manner that won't detract from the proposed financial opportunities.
pros: An updated printing that takes years of sound advice and applies it to modern day scenarios
Great for novice and seasoned investors
Touches upon high-level investment tips as well as those that can be accomplished in daily life
cons: Very conservative in its advice – to the dismay of readers who hunger for more risk

customer_reviews.title: The perfect antidote to Jim Cramer
customer_reviews.text: I've owned every edition of this book. Of all the investment guides I've read over the years, it's without a doubt the most straightforward and helpful. Best of all, its beautifully written and laced with humor and wit. Tobias takes his subject seriously and gives good advice, but he also has a light touch that makes the book fun to read--and to re-read. I go back to it regularly as an antidote to the frantic, hyper-hysterical investment advice being peddled by the Jim Cramers of world.

customer_reviews.title: Too much "personality" not enough actual content
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun little read if you're very young and want to learn the VERY basics of personal finance. This book is split into two sections; the first is all about saving money and avoiding scams (spend less, save more, don't trust people. The second section is about the stock market that basically just says most people, even professional investors, can't beat the market and it's safer to invest in index funds. 300 pages, summed up in a two sentences. The rest is a lot of filler. It's a total waste of money if you're looking for an actual resource to guide you on investing.
